description: Though I didn't use it.
The app intregrates great with the Gnome desktop, and keeps cruft to a mimimum.
I have set the clock on desktop (Center) in Fedora 24. Looks great.
Has a nice user interface for time related functions for a minimal viable product. Alarm clock does not work in the background, does not offer to set up a custom alarm sound.
It looks really great, and functions excellently too.

I wish if GNOME Clocks would deeply integrate with GNOME Shell because otherwise you would keep it opened in order to use the Alarm for an example and what about when the PC sleeps shouldn't GNOME Clocks be able to wake the PC up to ring the alarm like "Free Alarm Clock" for Windows does, Also the world clocks are bit dull when a specific clock is selected with so much unused white space.

I hope if the developers would consider looking at the Alarm and World Clock which are pre-installed on Samsung GALAXY Note 10.1 tablet GT-N8000, If GNOME Clocks can gain parity with the default apps on the GT-N8000 it would be an awesome application.
A very good app!
Nice clock app!
summary: A very nice and simple app

description: Time is off by 3 minutes and there is no way to just manually adjust the time.

Not good for waking up. Should really play a sound.
Pretty solid app, I don't use it for much except the world clocks

The installation get stuck without any sign of life, after reboot the app works fine, but it's very basic and not possibility for configuration exists. E.g. it's not possible to change the alarm ring, nor the duration of it.
Removal of the app is as painful as installation.
Overall my evaluation is 2.5 stars: I'm sure there are better apps.

description: I mean, it works, kind of. If you find yourself needing a timer or stopwatch, it's handy. I suppose it might be useful if you do a lot of business with other timezones. On the other hand, the alarm clock is complete junk. There's no option to change the sound it plays and the alarm doesn't go off if the app isn't open. For the most part, this is just something to take up space in the app drawer.
Alarm works! Awesomee

PRO
* world clocks appear in the notification bar
* simple interface

CONS
* alarms work only if the app is opened
* stopwatch is not very precise (only one decimal)
Perfect for not forgetting my pizza in the oven

This app uses 15% of cpu when I run stopwatch.
You can try to make more cpu friendly app.

Completely useless, since it has to remain open on the desktop for alarms to trigger, and doesn't minimize in the system bar.
People who designed this are not the brightest.
Very big on 2x scaled display and do not support russian cities. E.g., if I add any russian city, it won't show it in the calendar menu at the top bar and shows wrong (my local) time.

I refuse to use this because it is racist..
Even though it has Gaza, Palestine in it's drop down menu it will not allow it to be added. However it will allow Tel Aviv..
I am not using it purely for this reason...!

description: This came preinstalled in my Xubuntu 20.05. This is a problem because I need recurring alarms at set times while working on my computer so I can take proper breaks without relying on my phone or another device!

description:
Thank you for the app. I've got some recommendations.

1. Alarm & Timer sound volume should be high to some extent. As you know, I can't notice the warning sound. It would be a great idea to let user choose his/her favourite songs.

2. Space arrangement is necessary. Even though the software is maximized, the Alarm & Timer roles can't change. The Alarm & Timer roles are always the same, i.e., one after another. It can be coloum-based then it's more convenient for the users.

Try to use it in Unity 7. Application has the following problems:

1. Alarm doesn't work at all. Don't see any notifications.
2. There is no system applet.

Una esfera de 24h, con indicador de salida y ocaso solar y lunar, fase lunar, un puntito para señalar las 0 horas GMT, poder añadir esferas (circunferencias) con las horas de otro lugar/es incluso una con bits (Internet time) mas poner en números dentro de la esfera la hora sería una aplicación casi completa (algo mas se le podría añadir seguro) a la que se le podría ir añadiendo otras opciones de configuración como pulsómetro, barómetro, predicción de lluvia /no luvia en la esfera etc para ser usada incluso en dispositivos de pulsera.

Podría ofrecer más sonidos de alarma, y dar la opción de elegir algún archivo de sonido. Deberían corregir también, tanto en esta como otras aplicaciones Gnome (como el Tiempo), la ubicación de algunas ciudades. Artigas, por ejemplo, NO ES DE BRASIL, ES DE URUGUAY.

Dans le dogme de la simplicité maximale, on ne peut même pas configurer le son de l'alarme ! Et le son par défaut est juste insupportable.
j'ai beaucoup aimé
donne les heures de beaucoup d'endroit dans le monde, mais ne change pas aux horaires d'hivers et d'été.
Le niveau de son est faible, l'alerte visuelle beaucoup trop brève. Aucun des deux n'est configurable. Tel que c'est inutilisable sauf comme chronomètre.
J'aimerais changer les sons des alarmes et du minuteur.

Rudimentaire. Efficace au niveau de l'alarme qui ne s'arrête que si on clique sur le bouton "Arrêter" (son strident)

Monde : affiche l'heure (+ celles du lever et coucher de soleil)
NB : N'affiche pas une carte du monde avec la zone illuminée par le soleil

Alarmes : Désactivées à la création (ne pas oublier de l'activer). Le son est strident (si paramètres > Son > Volume système est suffisamment haut). Bémol, la fenêtre surgissante (avec nom de l'alarme) ne s'affiche pas assez longtemps (+/- 5 secondes) 

Chronomètre : un seul ... mais c'est suffisant

Minuteurs : Son bref et pas terrible. La fenêtre surgissante (message identique pour chaque minuteur) ne s'affiche pas assez longtemps (+/- 5 secondes) 

Affichage en français
Installation ultra rapide.

Améliorations souhaitées : Paramètrages du fichier son (temps, fichier.mp3, volume) et de la durée d'affichage de la fenêtre surgissante.
=> une étoile de moins à l'évaluation

L'alarme ne retentit que si la fenêtre de configuration des alarmes est ouverte => il faut ne jamais oublier de l'ouvrir (et de la minimiser si nécessaire), et alors ça fonctionne, faut juste pas oublier de l'ouvrir, cherchez l'erreur :-D :-D :-D...
application performante, simple eet efficace !
